# IUCN Red List R Package

# 

## About This Project

Started in September 2024, this project originated when
[`rredlist`](https://github.com/ropensci/rredlist) was still tied to the
deprecated IUCN Red List V3 API. By January 2025, `rredlist` had
transitioned to support the V4 API, introducing substantial structural
changes. I continued developing my own approach, which led to
[`redlist`](https://github.com/stangandaho/redlist) â€” a standalone
client designed around consistent tibble outputs and streamlined
workflows.

In parallel, there is also the official IUCN-supported package
[`iucnredlist`](https://iucn-uk.github.io/iucnredlist/), which provides
direct access to the same V4 API. Although these packages all use API
V4, they differ in design: `redlist` focuses on a fresh, independent
approach with uniform inputs and outputs for all endpoints, while
`iucnredlist` represents the official reference implementation.  
These differences mean the packages are not in competition but are
complementary, serving different user preferences.

## Get started

### ðŸ“¦ Installation

``` r
# Install from CRAN
install.packages("redlist")

# Install from GitHub
if (!requireNamespace("pak", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("pak", dependencies = TRUE)
}
pak::pkg_install("stangandaho/redlist")

# Load
library(redlist)
```

### ðŸ”‘ Set Your API Key

If youâ€™re using this package for the first time, youâ€™ll likely need an
IUCN Red List API key.  
You can check whether itâ€™s set by running
[`rl_check_api()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_check_api.md).  
If this throws an error like â€˜*! No Redlist API key foundâ€¦* â€™, youâ€™ll
need to set an API key before using any of the package functions. Just
follow these two simple steps:  
1. Visit the official IUCN Red List API website
[here](https://api.iucnredlist.org/users/edit). Create an account if you
donâ€™t already have one. Once logged in, you can request your API key.  
2. Copy your API key and set it using the
[`rl_set_api()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_set_api.md)
function, like this `rl_set_api("2GoWiThmYrEDlitApiThatWorkS4me")`.  
You can then run
[`rl_check_api()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_check_api.md)
again to confirm that your API key is set successfully.

> *Please ensure that you have read and agreed to the [API key terms of
> use](https://www.iucnredlist.org/terms/terms-of-use) and have complied
> with them during your usage.*

## Usage

The `redlist` package offers simple functions to retrieve and explore
IUCN Red List data.

``` r
# Retrieve Red List data for Benin (country code "BJ"), first page by default
benin_redlist <- rl_countries(code = "BJ")  # Get first 100 records
head(benin_redlist)                         # Preview the data

# Retrieve data from first 5 pages (up to 500 records)
benin_redlist_pages <- rl_countries(code = "BJ", page = 1:5)

# Retrieve data from first 5 pages, filtered by year published 2023
benin_redlist_2023 <- rl_countries(code = "BJ", page = 1:5, year_published = 2023)

# Retrieve all available data for Benin (no page limit)
benin_redlist_all <- rl_countries(code = "BJ", page = NA)

# Get detailed species info by passing a species sis_id (example: 137286)
species_info <- rl_sis(sis_id = 137286)

# Get detailed assessment info by passing an assessment_id (example: 522738)
assessment_info <- rl_assessment_id(assessment_id = 522738)

# Loop through multiple assessment_ids to collect detailed data for all species
all_species_details <- lapply(benin_redlist$assessments_assessment_id, function(id) {
  rl_assessment_id(assessment_id = id)
}) %>% dplyr::bind_rows()
```

**For a full overview of all available functions, please visit the
[redlist
website](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/index.html)**

## Code of conduct

Please note that this project is based on the [Contributor Covenant
v2.1](https://github.com/stangandaho/redlist/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).
By participating in this project you agree to abide by its terms.

## Getting help

If you encounter a clear bug, please file an
[issue](https://github.com/stangandaho/redlist/issues) with a minimal
reproducible example. For questions and other discussion, please use
[relevant section](https://github.com/stangandaho/redlist/discussions).

# Package index

## Set

Set and check IUCN red list API key.

- [`rl_set_api()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_set_api.md)
  : Set the IUCN Red List API key
- [`rl_check_api()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_check_api.md)
  : Check IUCN Red List API Status

## Assessment

Function to retrieve assessment data for a specific assessment_id.

- [`rl_assessment_id()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_assessment_id.md)
  : IUCN Red List assessment

## Biogeographical Realms

Function to list and query biogeographical realms and their assessments.

- [`rl_biogeographical_realms()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_biogeographical_realms.md)
  : IUCN Red List biogeographical realms

## Comprehensive Groups

Function to list and query comprehensive groups and their assessments.

- [`rl_comprehensive_groups()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_comprehensive_groups.md)
  : IUCN Red List Comprehensive groups

## Conservation Actions

Function to list and query conservation actions and their assessments.

- [`rl_conservation_actions()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_conservation_actions.md)
  : IUCN Red List conservation action

## Countries

Function to list countries and query assessments by country code.

- [`rl_countries()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_countries.md)
  : Retrieve IUCN Red List assessments by country

## FAOs

Function to list FAOs and query assessments by FAO code.

- [`rl_faos()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_faos.md)
  : FAO marine fishing areas

## Growth Forms

Function to list growth forms and query assessments by growth form code.

- [`rl_growth_forms()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_growth_forms.md)
  : Growth forms

## Green Status

Function to list all Green Status assessments.

- [`rl_green_status()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_green_status.md)
  : Green status

## Habitats

Function to list habitat codes and query assessments by habitat code.

- [`rl_habitats()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_habitats.md)
  : Habitats

## Information

Function to retrieve API and Red List version information.

- [`rl_version()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_version.md)
  : IUCN Red List and API version

## Population Trends

Function to list population trends and query assessments by trend code.

- [`rl_population_trends()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_population_trends.md)
  : IUCN Red List population trends

## Red List Categories

Function to list Red List categories and query assessments by category
code.

- [`rl_red_list_categories()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_red_list_categories.md)
  : IUCN Red List Categories

## Research

Function to list research codes and query assessments by research code.

- [`rl_research()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_research.md)
  : IUCN Red List research categories

## Scopes

Functions to list scopes and query assessments by scope code.

- [`rl_scopes()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_scopes.md)
  : IUCN Red List assessment scopes

## Statistics

Function to retrieve aggregated statistics.

- [`rl_statistics()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_statistics.md)
  : IUCN Red List statistics

## Stresses

Function to list stressors and query assessments by stress code.

- [`rl_stresses()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_stresses.md)
  : IUCN Red List stress categories

## Systems

Function to list systems and query assessments by system code.

- [`rl_systems()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_systems.md)
  : IUCN Red List ecological systems

## Taxa

Functions to retrieve summary assessment data at species and higher
taxonomic levels.

- [`rl_sis()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_sis.md)
  : IUCN Red List taxa by SIS ID
- [`rl_scientific_name()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_scientific_name.md)
  : IUCN Red List taxa by scientific name
- [`rl_kingdoms()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_kingdoms.md)
  : IUCN Red List taxa by kingdom
- [`rl_phylum()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_phylum.md)
  : IUCN Red List taxa by phylum
- [`rl_classes()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_classes.md)
  : IUCN Red List taxa by class
- [`rl_orders()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_orders.md)
  : IUCN Red List taxa by order
- [`rl_family()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_family.md)
  : IUCN Red List taxa by family
- [`rl_possibly_extinct()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_possibly_extinct.md)
  : IUCN Red List possibly extinct taxa
- [`rl_possibly_extinct_in_wild()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_possibly_extinct_in_wild.md)
  : IUCN Red List possibly extinct in the wild taxa
- [`rl_open_file()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_open_file.md)
  : Open file for editing

## Threats

Function to list threat codes and query assessments by threat code.

- [`rl_threats()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_threats.md)
  : IUCN Red List threat categories

## Use and Trade

Function to list use and trade codes and query assessments by code.

- [`rl_use_and_trade()`](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/reference/rl_use_and_trade.md)
  : IUCN Red List use and trade categories

  Areas](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/articles/GBIF-and-IUCN-Red-List.md):

  package](https://stangandaho.github.io/redlist/articles/get_data.md):
